metadata.title: CVE-2021-39685 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In various setup methods of the USB gadget subsystem, there is a possibleout of bounds write due to an incorrect flag check. This could lead tolocal escalation of privilege with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product:AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-210292376References: Upstreamkernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required
